LOL the amount of review bombing is insane, borderline outrageous and even ridiculous if you ask me.

The game is fun, as it has always been. Don't know why you're complaining about the battle pass, literally every single live service game has it (just don't buy it? It's all cosmetics anyway).

Somehow people has super high expectations of this game, i've never understood why really. It's a nice addicting team based little game, it's from Blizzard so it will never be important. Somehow people forgets that Blizzard shined with WoW WotlK and Diablo 2. It's been downhill since then and honestly, that's ok. Blizzard don't care about manufactoring masterpieces anymore, they don't care. And it's ok.

In reflection of that i don't care also, i just care about having fun with a couple matches. Overwatch in general is a quite different shooter than all the CoD and BF fiesta and i'm happy with it when i want a change of pace.

[h1] Overwatch [b]BAD[/b]; Team Fortress 2 [b]GOOD[/b]. [/h1]

I wanted to do this for such a long time.
Blizzard Entertainment is not Blizzard Entertainment anymore

tl;dr: They took a fullprice game, realized no one bought loot boxes and then abadoned it to make a sequel that's the usual F2P battlepass shit. It is playable, it is fun. But it is not in comparison to what Overwatch 1 was. They did so good on so many fronts, but the entire upper management that makes ethically questionable decisions ruined this.

****

I have 2000 hours in this game, this was my #1 when it came out. It was fun, casual, or you could get competitive. Yes it had a lot of balancing issues in the beginning, but literally any game does. Play League with 5 Bruisers/Tanks and it's literally the same problem. 

But it was fun, I unlocked every stupid cosmetic without having to pay a single cent extra. I played 80% of this rooster more than I have played other games in my library. 

They just abandoned it after Brigitte came out, ignored how she broke the flow of the matches and then just decided to make OW2. No new content meant players were leaving, Brigitte alone killed the pro scene's interest, because you could just brick a game with the same boring line up.
